Bash(tail -3 uv run python -c "
import matplotlib
matplotlib.use(''''Agg'''')
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

# Create a 2x2 grid of subplots - returns an array of Axes
fig, axes = plt.subplots(2, 2, figsize=(8, 8))
axes[0, 0].plot([1, 2, 3], [1, 4, 9])
axes[0, 1].scatter([1, 2, 3], [9, 4, 1])
axes[1, 0].bar([''''A'''', ''''B'''', ''''C''''], [3, 7, 2])
axes[1, 1].hist(np.random.randn(100))
fig.suptitle(''''2x2 Grid Test'''')

# Test the extraction function
from rileyviewer.adapters import _extract_figure_from_axes_array
extracted = _extract_figure_from_axes_array(axes)
print(f''''axes type: {type(axes)}'''')
print(f''''axes shape: {axes.shape}'''')
print(f''''extracted figure: {extracted}'''')
print(f''''same as original fig: {extracted is fig}'''')

# Now test sending through viewer
from rileyviewer import Viewer
v = Viewer(open_browser=False)
plot_id = v.show(axes)  # Pass the axes array directly
print(f''''Sent plot: {plot_id[:8]}...'''')
")
